context_bundle.summary: Age-related cognitive changes: Processing speed decline (most robust), working memory reduction, episodic memory impairment, preserved semantic memory/crystallized intelligence. MCI vs dementia differentiation, cognitive reserve, protective factors.

onboarding.quick_start: Processing speed declines ~15% per decade after 30. Episodic memory vulnerable, semantic preserved. Cognitive reserve (education/occupation/engagement) delays clinical symptoms. Physical exercise is neuroprotective.
common_patterns: Processing speed: First to decline, cascades to other domains, explains ~50% of age-related variance
Memory: Episodic encoding/retrieval impaired, semantic intact until late-stage, procedural preserved
Executive function: Set-shifting, inhibition, updating decline - frontal vulnerability hypothesis
Cognitive reserve: Higher baseline = longer before symptoms manifest, same pathology different presentation
known_errors: Assuming all decline is pathological - normal aging has trajectory
Ignoring modifiable risk factors - 40% of dementia potentially preventable
Confusing MCI with early dementia - MCI may be stable or revert
Dismissing complaints as 'just aging' - can miss treatable causes
